__description__: Appendix A — Search Parameters for the ELIS (Electoral Integrity Systematic Literature Review). This JSON documents the databases, queries, eligibility criteria, tooling, and governance rules used to reproduce searches. It reflects ELIS Protocol v1.4 (16 Aug 2025), which frames research since 1990, includes EN/FR/ES/PT sources, and requires human validation of any AI-assisted steps.

research_questions.text: What operational and technological strategies have demonstrably improved the integrity or auditability of electoral systems since 1990?
What types of empirical designs and evaluation frameworks have been used to assess the effectiveness of electoral integrity strategies since 1990?

analytical_subquestions: Which technological/operational mechanisms are associated with increased auditability or verifiability?
Under what institutional, legal, or regulatory conditions were these mechanisms implemented?
How did these strategies influence public trust or perceived legitimacy?
What regional patterns or cross-national differences are observed?
inclusion_criteria: Empirical designs (quantitative, qualitative, or mixed) assessing integrity, auditability, transparency, or trust
exclusion_criteria: Purely theoretical essays lacking methodological rigour
Studies only about party politics/turnout with no link to voting system design
Unverifiable or AI-generated items without traceable sources
Any inclusion/exclusion decision made solely by AI without human reviewer confirmation

information_sources.name: Latin American sources (OAS, FLACSO, TSE Brazil)

principles: AI may draft candidate strings; a human validates and finalises all queries
Boolean structure targets voting technology + auditability + evaluation terms
Search logs and filters are versioned for reproducibility

example_query_strings.scopus: TITLE-ABS-KEY(("electoral integrity" OR "e-voting" OR "electronic voting" OR "ballot auditability" OR "voting trust") AND ("VVPAT" OR "end-to-end verifiability" OR "risk-limiting audit" OR "cryptographic" OR "blockchain") AND (evaluation OR "empirical study" OR "comparative analysis")) AND PUBYEAR > 1989
example_query_strings.wos: TS=(("electoral integrity" OR "electronic voting" OR e-voting OR "ballot auditability" OR "voting trust") AND (VVPAT OR "end-to-end verifiability" OR "risk-limiting audit" OR cryptographic OR blockchain) AND (evaluation OR "empirical study" OR "comparative analysis")) AND PY=1990-2025
example_query_strings.google_scholar: "electoral integrity" (VVPAT OR "end-to-end verifiability" OR "risk-limiting audit" OR cryptographic OR blockchain) (evaluation OR "empirical study" OR "comparative analysis") since:1990
example_query_strings.ieee: ("electronic voting" OR e-voting) AND (auditability OR verifiability OR "risk-limiting audit" OR cryptographic OR VVPAT) AND (evaluation OR implementation OR case study) Year:1990-2025
example_query_strings.acm: ("electronic voting" OR e-voting) AND (auditability OR verifiability OR VVPAT OR cryptographic) AND (evaluation OR usability OR case study) Year:1990-2025

llm_assist.logging: All AI-assisted steps recorded in Appendix F — AI Agents Log

governance.amendments: Changes captured in changelog and mirrored to OSF registration

notes: Scopus/WoS/IEEE/ACM syntax varies by platform; refine operators per database interface before execution.

records.search_string: ("electoral integrity" OR "election audit") AND (technology OR ICT) AND year:>=1990
